intro: Garnotia tenella, commonly known as the slender garnotia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Garnotia tenella is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or open woodlands.
